column4: could anyone in here help me with ndiswrapper? everyone in it's channel has been idle for atleast 8 hours. I've installed it but can't get the drivers installed
what card do you have

I downloaded the reccomended driver, but my problem is this, When I try to open ndiswrapper under util, nothing happens and when I run it in a terminal it immediately dissapears. I'm not sure how it works, i'm assuming since there is no actual app open that it is a service, so i tried ndiswrapper -i <filename> and I get ndiswrapper not a command
ndiswrapper is a driver wrapper

I've been following the wiki and all is good up to this point, except the next step says  use ndiswrapper tool to install the driver with "ndiswrapper -i filename.inf", i tried that in a terminal and i get "ndiswrapper is not a command", or something to that affect
did you install or compile _ndiswrapper_ ?
yes, I did, I followed the install wiki and compiled it into the kernel source. although on the make I got a couple errors saying gcc command not found, or whatever the error is
that means you didnt compile it
you need build-essential
this is a better wiki https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SetupNdiswrapperHowto
what is build-essential? the wiki said make distclean, make, make install should compile and install both the kernel module and userspcae utilities
review that... You must have development tools to be able to compile it
i ran into a little trouble with that wiki at this command: sed -e "s/misc/kernel\/drivers\/net\/ndiswrapper/g" debian/rules > debian/temp. I dont understand that at all.
where did you see that command.. What page are you using?
the format is wrong
what is the proper command?
could you give me a link to the page you are using?
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SetupNdiswrapperHowto
it's step 5
try this instead        sed -e "s/misc/kernel/drivers/net/ndiswrapper/g" debian/rules > debian/temp
there was a specific error with that other command when it got to the "s part, it wasn't a recognized flag or something
remove the s  and see what it does
does it work>
